hatred.name: Hatred
hatred.description:
Your hatred for a particular enemy of the Imperium runs deep. Each time you take this move, select one of the groups below and describe how your hatred took root. Whenever you deal damage against a hated enemy, roll an extra damage die.

  • Xenos (choose a species)
  • Criminals
  • Daemons
  • Psykers
  • Mutants
  • Cultists

rapid_reload.name: Rapid Reload
rapid_reload.description: When you attempt to reload quickly roll+{{stat 'ag'}}. On a 10+ you reload your weapon instantly - reset its uses and reduce your ammo by one. On a 7-9 the same in addition to what that the GM says. On a 6- you fumble your reload.

spout_forbidden_lore.name: Spout Forbidden Lore
spout_forbidden_lore.description: When you consult your accumulated knowledge about a forbidden topic you have learned, roll+{{stat 'int'}}. On a 10+, the GM will tell you something interesting and useful about the subject relevant to your situation. On a 7–9, the GM will only tell you something interesting—it’s on you to make it useful. Be careful, too much comfort with blasphemous knowledge can draw the eye of loyal servants of the Imperium.

aid_or_interfere.name: Aid or Interfere
aid_or_interfere.description: When you help or hinder someone, describe how and roll+bond with them. On a 10+ add +2 or -2 to their roll, your choice. On a 7-9 add +1 or -1 to their roll, your choice, but you open yourself up to danger, retribution, or cost.

basic_tech_use.name: Basic Tech-Use
basic_tech_use.description:
When you attempt to use an advanced piece of technology, or repair a simple piece, roll+{{stat 'int'}}. On a 10+ you do what you set out to do and choose one. On a 7-9 the same, but choose two:

  • It takes longer than you'd planned
  • You have to cannibalize some equipment on hand, the GM will tell you what
  • You get a lesser result than you intended, the GM will tell you what

defend.name: Defend
defend.description:
When you stand in defense of a person, item, or location under attack, roll+{{stat 't'}}. On a 10+, hold 3. On a 7–9, hold 1. So long as you stand in defense, when you or the thing you defend is attacked you may spend hold, 1 for 1, to choose an option:

  • Redirect an attack from the thing you defend to yourself
  • Halve the attack's effect or damage
  • Open up the attacker to an ally giving that ally +1 forward against the attacker

defy_danger.name: Defy Danger
defy_danger.description:
When you act despite an imminent threat or suffer a calamity, say how you deal with it and roll. If you do it

  • by using skill in melee attacks, +{{stat 'ws'}}
  • by using skill with ranged weapons, +{{stat 'bs'}}
  • by powering through, +{{stat 'str'}}
  • by getting out of the way or acting fast, +{{stat 'ag'}}
  • by enduring, +{{stat 't'}}
  • with quick thinking, +{{stat 'int'}}
  • using charm and social grace, +{{stat 'fel'}}
  • through mental fortitude, +{{stat 'wp'}}
  • noticing something, +{{stat 'per'}}

On a 10+, you do what you set out to, the threat doesn’t come to bear. On a 7–9, you stumble, hesitate, or flinch: the GM will offer you a worse outcome, hard bargain, or ugly choice.

discern_realities.name: Discern Realities
discern_realities.description:
When you closely study a situation or person, roll+Wis. On a 10+, ask the GM 3 questions from the list below. On a 7–9, ask 1.

Either way, take +1 forward when acting on the answers.

  • What happened here recently?
  • What is about to happen?
  • What should I be on the lookout for?
  • What here is useful or valuable to me?
  • Who’s really in control here?
  • What here is not what it appears to be?

fire_for_effect.name: Fire for Effect
fire_for_effect.description:
When you fire your ranged weapon to deal damage, roll+{{stat 'bs'}} and expend a use of your weapon. On a 10+ deal your damage. At your option you may expend another use of your weapon to add +1d4 damage. On a 7-9 you deal your damage and choose one:

  • You take what you can get, deal -1d6 damage
  • You need to take some more shots, expend another use of your weapon
  • You have to place yourself or a teammate in danger, the GM will tell you how
fire_for_effect.explanation:
{{fire_for_effect.name}} is your go-to move when a character is shooting to kill. It covers drawing, cocking, aiming, and shooting your weapon. Firing your weapon doesn't mean squeezing off a single shot, it means shooting for a few seconds. That can mean a single shot, or a whole flurry of them. Either way, it's a single use of the weapon. Leave the exact number of shots to the fiction and let the uses dictate when they run low.

If you're using a weapon that doesn't have enough uses you can't take the bonus damage on the 10+ or the "expend another use" option on a 7-9.

hack_and_slash.name: Hack and Slash
hack_and_slash.description: When you attack an enemy in melee, roll+{{stat 'ws'}}. On a 10+, you deal your damage to the enemy and avoid their attack. At your option, you may choose to roll an extra damage die but expose yourself to the enemy's attack. On a 7-9, you deal your damage to the enemy and the enemy makes an attack against you.
hack_and_slash.explanation: The extra damage die you roll will be the largest size that you are already rolling. If your attack deals 1d8+1d6 damage, you would roll 2d8+1d6.

parley.name: Parley
parley.description: When you have leverage on a GM Character and manipulate them, roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. Leverage is something they need or want. On a 10+, they do what you ask if you first promise what they ask of you. On a 7–9, they will do what you ask, but need some concrete assurance of your promise, right now.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: When you take a moment to reload your weapon reset your weapon's uses and expend 1 ammo.
reload.explanation: Once a character has expended all the uses of their weapon they need to reload. This isn't assumed, the players have to explicitly say they take a moment to reload. How long it takes is up to the GM, and reloading certainly counts as a prime opportunity for a GM move.

spout_common_lore.name: Spout Common Lore
spout_common_lore.description: When you consult your accumulated knowledge about a non-forbidden topic, roll+{{stat 'int'}}. On a 10+, the GM will tell you something interesting and useful about the subject relevant to your situation. On a 7–9, the GM will only tell you something interesting—it’s on you to make it useful. The GM might ask you “How do you know this?” Tell them the truth, now.

suppressing_fire.name: Suppressing Fire
suppressing_fire.description: When you fire a weapon at one or more targets to suppress them, roll+{{stat 'bs'}} and expend 1 use of your weapon. On a hit the target's morale is tested: they might dive for cover, falter, or attempt to flee. Your allies gain +1 forward against them. On a 10+ you also deal your damage.
suppressing_fire.explanation: If you're shooting at the enemy for almost any effect other than to hit something, you're likely using suppressing fire. You might still land a few shots, but what you're trying to do is keep heads down so your allies can take advantage.

throw_grenade.name: Throw Grenade
throw_grenade.description:
When you prime and throw a grenade, roll+{{stat 'str'}}. On a 10+, the grenade lands where you aimed. On a 7-9 choose one:

  • The grenade lands where you aimed but you have to move to make the throw placing you or someone else in danger as described by the GM
  • The grenade only lands near where you aimed, for a reduced or unexpected effect as described by the GM
throw_grenade.explanation: Pulling out a grenade and chucking it can all be done in one motion, but only if you have a grenade on hand. As a GM, the 7-9 results give you a lot of opportunity for interesting hard moves, don't be afraid to use them. A wily cultist might see an Acolyte fumbling for a grenade as a perfect opportunity to charge them. A grenade might fall short and deal half damage, or it might catch an ally in its blast. Explosives can also change the landscape of the battlefield by creating firewalls, caving in walls, making craters, or destroying cover.

blend_in.name: Blend In
blend_in.description:
When you stay still to remain inconspicuous as someone passes by, roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 10+ choose two, on a 7-9 choose one:

  • They continue moving past
  • They won't remember your face

cheap_shot.name: Cheap Shot
cheap_shot.description: When using a precise or hand weapon, your {{move unsuspecting_strike}} deals an extra +1d6 damage.

faceless.name: Faceless
faceless.description: When you talk to someone you don't want to remember you, roll+{{stat 'wp'}}. On a 10+ they don't remember you, and barely remember the conversation. On a 7-9 they don't remember specifics about you, but they remember what they talked about.

preferred_kill.name: Preferred Kill
preferred_kill.description:
You have focused your training on either hand-to-hand or ranged attacks. Choose one:

  • Blademaster: Once per encounter you may reroll a move that uses your {{statistic 'ws'}}.
  • Sharptshooter: Once per encounter you may reroll a move that uses your {{statistic 'bs'}}.

silencing_strike.name: Silencing Strike
silencing_strike.description: When you roll {{move unsuspecting_strike}} you always prevent your target from raising the alarm, describe how.

underdog.name: Underdog
underdog.description: When you're outnumbered, you have +1 defense against melee attacks.

unsuspecting_strike.name: Unsuspecting Strike
unsuspecting_strike.description:
When you get close to your target to make a surprise attack, roll+{{stat 'ag'}} if you use stealth or speed, or roll+{{stat 'fel'}} if you use deception or charm. On a 10+ choose two. On a 7-9 choose one.

  • You don't get into melee with them
  • You deal your damage + 1d6
  • You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it
  • Reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it

confessor.name: Confessor
confessor.description:
When you interrogate someone to extract information from them roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 7-9 they answer your questions and you choose 2. On a 10+ choose 1 instead.

  • They only answer one question
  • Their answers are vague
  • They resist for longer than you'd planned before they begin to cooperate
  • They attract the attention of those nearby

detective.name: Detective
detective.description: When you get a 7+ using {{move discern_realities}} on a crime scene you also find a clue of value to you. On a 10+ this clue gives you a hunch that the GM will describe.

take_them_alive.name: Take Them Alive
take_them_alive.description:
If you successfully hit a vulnerable opponent and attempt to disable them instead of dealing damage. roll+{{stat 's'}}. On a 7+ they are incapacitated. On a 7-9 choose 1:

  • They get one last attack in
  • They will need some time to recover to be of any use

this_ones_mine.name: This One's Mine
this_ones_mine.description: When you call out a target as your own, you deal +2d4 ongoing to them. This lasts until an ally attacks them, you attack someone else, or the target is defeated. While this is active you deal -4 damage to other targets and your allies deal -2 damage to your named target.

torturer.name: Torturer
torturer.description: When you roll a 7+ with {{move confessor}} you may choose to select zero options from the list. If you do so, roll+Int – on a 6- your captive dies.

baptised_by_bullets.name: Baptised By Bullets
baptised_by_bullets.description: Whenever you run through enemy fire, take +1 forward to {{move defy_danger}}.

lifting_the_fog.name: Lifting the Fog
lifting_the_fog.description:
The fog of war can mask any battle. As you witness it unfold, whenever you or someone you have a bond with takes damage gain 1 {{tactician.resource}} (Max 2). During the battle you may spend 1 {{tactician.resource}} to:

  • Add +1 to one of your rolls before your roll
  • Reroll a damage roll (yours or an ally's)

At the end of the battle your {{tactician.resource}} resets to 0.

sense_weakness.name: Sense Weakness
sense_weakness.description:
When you {{move discern_realities}} about a person or being, you may add the following question to your list of options:

  • What weaknesses do I see?

You may spend 1 {{tactician.resource}} to ask this as an extra question.

tactical_advantage.name: Tactical Advantage
tactical_advantage.description:
Each battle is different and requires a different approach. At the start of each battle, decide which tactic you are actively employing.

  • Defensive: As long as you don't attempt to gain ground, you gain +1 to all {{move defy_danger}} rolls
  • Reactive: Whenever you are attacked, you can immediately respond and take +1 forward
  • Reckless: You deal an extra damage die, but your defense is reduced by 1
  • Precise: While you remain focused on a single target, you inflict +1 wounds when you damage them

If you change tactics you lose the benefit of the one you had chosen.

divine_will.name: Divine Will
divine_will.description: When you use the Emperor's impending vengeance as leverage, you may roll {{move parley}} with +{{templar.resource}} instead of +{{stat 'fel'}}.

holy_vengeance.name: Holy Vengeance
holy_vengeance.description: When you kill an enemy that has done you harm, you gain 1 {{templar.resource}}.

judgement.name: Judgement
judgement.description: When you declare for all to hear someone's crimes deserving of punishment, spend 1 {{templar.resource}}. The next time you attack them, treat their defense as 1 lower.

know_thy_enemy.name: Know Thy Enemy
know_thy_enemy.description: Your zeal for exacting the Emperor's wrath has led you to know of some of the Imperium's greatest enemies. You may {{move spout_forbidden_lore}} about known heretics, witches, and traitors.

penance.name: Penance
penance.description: When you quickly perform penance, you suffer 1 wound and gain 1 {{templar.resource}}. Penance is self punishment, such as tightening a cilice, using a whip or knout, or other forms of mortification of the ﬂesh. This type of brutal penance might be painful, but it's the only way to purify your soul quickly, such as in the midst of a battle.

smite.name: Smite
smite.description:
When you roll a 10+ on {{move hack_and_slash}} or {{move fire_for_effect}} you may spend 1 {{templar.resource}} to choose one:

  • Your attack burns with the Emperor's fury, inflict +1 wound
  • Your attack creates an opening, you and your allies take +1 forward against your target

wrath_embodied.name: Wrath Embodied
wrath_embodied.description:
You are the Emperor's vengeance made manifest and {{templay.resource}} is your currency. The more pure your soul, the more holy power can pass through you. If your soul is immaculate, then you have 3 {{templar.resource}} (the max).
When you spend time performing your purifcation ritual (an uninterrupted hour or so), set your {{templar.resource}} to the max.

armored.name: Armored
armored.description: You ignore the {{tag 'clumsy'}} tag on any armor you wear.

encumbrance.name: Encumbrance
encumbrance.description:
When you make a move while carrying weight you may be encumbered. If your weight carried is:

  • Equal to or less than your load, you suffer no penalty
  • Less than or equal to your load+2, you take -1 ongoing until you lighten your burden
  • Greater than your load+2, you have a choice: drop at least 1 weight and roll at -1, or automatically fail

end_of_session.name: End of Session
end_of_session.description:
When you reach the end of a session, choose one of your bonds that you feel is resolved (completely explored, no longer relevant, or otherwise). Ask the player of the character you have the bond with if they agree. If they do, mark XP and write a new bond with whomever you wish.

If you invoked your background with the {{move 'this_i_know'}} move this session, mark XP.

Once bonds have been updated look at your alignment or drive. If you fulfilled that alignment or drive at least once this session, mark XP. Then answer these three questions as a group:

  • Did we learn something new and important to the Inquisition?
  • Did we overcome a notable enemy?
  • Did we acquire a notable artifact that will be valuable to the Inquisition?

For each "yes" answer everyone marks XP.

last_breath.name: Last Breath
last_breath.description:
When you're dying you see the darkness cloud your vision as you drift into death. Describe what thoughts or prayers spur you on and roll (don't add any stats).

  • On a 10+ you've defied the odds, and barely cling to life.
  • On a 7-9 you live, but your brush with death takes its toll. Describe the lasting effects your body or mind take and the GM will tell you which of your statistics you must reduce permanently by 1.
  • On a 6-, you join the seemingly endless stream of souls to have been lost under the rule of the Imperium.

recover.name: Recover
recover.description: When you do nothing but rest in comfort and safety after a day of rest you recover half your max wounds.

this_i_know.name: This I Know
this_i_know.description: Once per session, you may invoke your Background to reroll a move. To invoke your Background you must describe how your character's experience or a specific event related to your Background would have helped you in the current situation. The GM and the players at the table have to agree, so the more details the better.

drives.name: Brutal
drives.description: Make a mess of a kill to intimidate others.

drives.name: Shadow
drives.description: Kill an enemy before they even know they're in danger.

drives.name: Reckless
drives.description: Leap into danger before a plan is formed.

looks: Blank eyes, fiery eyes, kind eyes
Military cut, messy hair, headband, helmet
Worn uniform, utilitarian clothes, rags
Lean body, hulking body, lithe body

destructive.name: Destructive
destructive.description: Blow something up or dismember a foe.

superious_position.name: Superior Position
superious_position.description: Gain an advantage due to better choice of terrain or surroundings.

weapon_master.name: Weapon Master
weapon_master.description: Use a new weapon in combat or begin training with one.

honor_killer.name: Honor Killer
honor_killer.description: Challenge a foe to 1v1 combat and defeat them.

basicmoves.explanation: If you're shooting at the enemy for almost any effect other than to hit something, you're likely using suppressing fire. You might still land a few shots, but what you're trying to do is keep heads down so your allies can take advantage.

basicmoves.name: Throw Grenade
basicmoves.description:
When you prime and throw a grenade, roll+{{stat 'str'}}. On a 10+, the grenade lands where you aimed. On a 7-9 choose one:

  • The grenade lands where you aimed but you have to move to make the throw placing you or someone else in danger as described by the GM
  • The grenade only lands near where you aimed, for a reduced or unexpected effect as described by the GM
basicmoves.explanation: Pulling out a grenade and chucking it can all be done in one motion, but only if you have a grenade on hand. As a GM, the 7-9 results give you a lot of opportunity for interesting hard moves, don't be afraid to use them. A wily cultist might see an Acolyte fumbling for a grenade as a perfect opportunity to charge them. A grenade might fall short and deal half damage, or it might catch an ally in its blast. Explosives can also change the landscape of the battlefield by creating firewalls, caving in walls, making craters, or destroying cover.

basicmoves.name: Defy Danger
basicmoves.description:
When you act despite an imminent threat or suffer a calamity, say how you deal with it and roll. If you do it

  • by using skill in melee attacks, +{{stat 'ws'}}
  • by using skill with ranged weapons, +{{stat 'bs'}}
  • by powering through, +{{stat 'str'}}
  • by getting out of the way or acting fast, +{{stat 'ag'}}
  • by enduring, +{{stat 't'}}
  • with quick thinking, +{{stat 'int'}}
  • using charm and social grace, +{{stat 'fel'}}
  • through mental fortitude, +{{stat 'wp'}}
  • noticing something, +{{stat 'per'}}

On a 10+, you do what you set out to, the threat doesn’t come to bear. On a 7–9, you stumble, hesitate, or flinch: the GM will offer you a worse outcome, hard bargain, or ugly choice.

basicmoves.name: Defend
basicmoves.description:
When you stand in defense of a person, item, or location under attack, roll+{{stat 't'}}. On a 10+, hold 3. On a 7–9, hold 1. So long as you stand in defense, when you or the thing you defend is attacked you may spend hold, 1 for 1, to choose an option:

  • Redirect an attack from the thing you defend to yourself
  • Halve the attack's effect or damage
  • Open up the attacker to an ally giving that ally +1 forward against the attacker

basicmoves.name: Discern Realities
basicmoves.description:
When you closely study a situation or person, roll+Wis. On a 10+, ask the GM 3 questions from the list below. On a 7–9, ask 1.

Either way, take +1 forward when acting on the answers.

  • What happened here recently?
  • What is about to happen?
  • What should I be on the lookout for?
  • What here is useful or valuable to me?
  • Who’s really in control here?
  • What here is not what it appears to be?

basicmoves.name: Spout Common Lore
basicmoves.description: When you consult your accumulated knowledge about a non-forbidden topic, roll+{{stat 'int'}}. On a 10+, the GM will tell you something interesting and useful about the subject relevant to your situation. On a 7–9, the GM will only tell you something interesting—it’s on you to make it useful. The GM might ask you “How do you know this?” Tell them the truth, now.

basicmoves.name: Basic Tech-Use
basicmoves.description:
When you attempt to use an advanced piece of technology, or repair a simple piece, roll+{{stat 'int'}}. On a 10+ you do what you set out to do and choose one. On a 7-9 the same, but choose two:

  • It takes longer than you'd planned
  • You have to cannibalize some equipment on hand, the GM will tell you what
  • You get a lesser result than you intended, the GM will tell you what

basicmoves.name: Aid or Interfere
basicmoves.description: When you help or hinder someone, describe how and roll+bond with them. On a 10+ add +2 or -2 to their roll, your choice. On a 7-9 add +1 or -1 to their roll, your choice, but you open yourself up to danger, retribution, or cost.

assassin.name: Assassin

starting_moves.name: Unsuspecting Strike
starting_moves.description:
When you get close to your target to make a surprise attack, roll+{{stat 'ag'}} if you use stealth or speed, or roll+{{stat 'fel'}} if you use deception or charm. On a 10+ choose two. On a 7-9 choose one.

  • You don't get into melee with them
  • You deal your damage + 1d6
  • You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it
  • Reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it

starting_moves.name: Blend In
starting_moves.description:
When you stay still to remain inconspicuous as someone passes by, roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 10+ choose two, on a 7-9 choose one:

  • They continue moving past
  • They won't remember your face

starting_moves.name: Preferred Kill
starting_moves.description:
You have focused your training on either hand-to-hand or ranged attacks. Choose one:

  • Blademaster: Once per encounter you may reroll a move that uses your {{statistic 'ws'}}.
  • Sharptshooter: Once per encounter you may reroll a move that uses your {{statistic 'bs'}}.

advanced_moves.name: Silencing Strike
advanced_moves.description: When you roll {{move unsuspecting_strike}} you always prevent your target from raising the alarm, describe how.

advanced_moves.name: Cheap Shot
advanced_moves.description: When using a precise or hand weapon, your {{move unsuspecting_strike}} deals an extra +1d6 damage.

advanced_moves.name: Underdog
advanced_moves.description: When you're outnumbered, you have +1 defense against melee attacks.

advanced_moves.name: Blend In
advanced_moves.description:
When you stay still to remain inconspicuous as someone passes by, roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 10+ choose two, on a 7-9 choose one:

  • They continue moving past
  • They won't remember your face

looks: Dead eyes, charming eyes, angry eyes
Black bodysuit, plain clothes, dirty rags
Buzz cut, elaborate hair, tattooed head
Slim body, athletic body, huge body

drives.name: Brutal
drives.description: Make a mess of a kill to intimidate others.

drives.name: Shadow
drives.description: Kill an enemy before they even know they're in danger.

drives.name: Reckless
drives.description: Leap into danger before a plan is formed.

seeker.name: Seeker
looks: Distrusting eyes, kind eyes, tired eyes
Helmeted head, military cut, or bald
Plain clothes, worn outfit, or uniform
Thin body, fit body, flabby body

starting_moves.name: Confessor
starting_moves.description:
When you interrogate someone to extract information from them roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 7-9 they answer your questions and you choose 2. On a 10+ choose 1 instead.

  • They only answer one question
  • Their answers are vague
  • They resist for longer than you'd planned before they begin to cooperate
  • They attract the attention of those nearby

starting_moves.name: Detective
starting_moves.description: When you get a 7+ using {{move discern_realities}} on a crime scene you also find a clue of value to you. On a 10+ this clue gives you a hunch that the GM will describe.

starting_moves.name: Take Them Alive
starting_moves.description:
If you successfully hit a vulnerable opponent and attempt to disable them instead of dealing damage. roll+{{stat 's'}}. On a 7+ they are incapacitated. On a 7-9 choose 1:

  • They get one last attack in
  • They will need some time to recover to be of any use

advanced_moves.name: This One's Mine
advanced_moves.description: When you call out a target as your own, you deal +2d4 ongoing to them. This lasts until an ally attacks them, you attack someone else, or the target is defeated. While this is active you deal -4 damage to other targets and your allies deal -2 damage to your named target.

advanced_moves.name: Torturer
advanced_moves.description: When you roll a 7+ with {{move confessor}} you may choose to select zero options from the list. If you do so, roll+Int – on a 6- your captive dies.

tactician.name: Tactician
tactician.description: You see the battlefield more clearly than most, and can use this insight to help you and your allies.

starting_moves.name: Tactical Advantage
starting_moves.description:
Each battle is different and requires a different approach. At the start of each battle, decide which tactic you are actively employing.

  • Defensive: As long as you don't attempt to gain ground, you gain +1 to all {{move defy_danger}} rolls
  • Reactive: Whenever you are attacked, you can immediately respond and take +1 forward
  • Reckless: You deal an extra damage die, but your defense is reduced by 1
  • Precise: While you remain focused on a single target, you inflict +1 wounds when you damage them

If you change tactics you lose the benefit of the one you had chosen.

starting_moves.name: Lifting the Fog
starting_moves.description:
The fog of war can mask any battle. As you witness it unfold, whenever you or someone you have a bond with takes damage gain 1 {{tactician.resource}} (Max 2). During the battle you may spend 1 {{tactician.resource}} to:

  • Add +1 to one of your rolls before your roll
  • Reroll a damage roll (yours or an ally's)

At the end of the battle your {{tactician.resource}} resets to 0.

starting_moves.name: Sense Weakness
starting_moves.description:
When you {{move discern_realities}} about a person or being, you may add the following question to your list of options:

  • What weaknesses do I see?

You may spend 1 {{tactician.resource}} to ask this as an extra question.

advanced_moves.name: Baptised By Bullets
advanced_moves.description: Whenever you run through enemy fire, take +1 forward to {{move defy_danger}}.

advanced_moves.name: Fighter's Sense
advanced_moves.description: You always start combat with +1 {{tactician.resource}}.

looks: Blank eyes, fiery eyes, kind eyes
Military cut, messy hair, headband, helmet
Worn uniform, utilitarian clothes, rags
Lean body, hulking body, lithe body

destructive.name: Destructive
destructive.description: Blow something up or dismember a foe.

superious_position.name: Superior Position
superious_position.description: Gain an advantage due to better choice of terrain or surroundings.

weapon_master.name: Weapon Master
weapon_master.description: Use a new weapon in combat or begin training with one.

honor_killer.name: Honor Killer
honor_killer.description: Challenge a foe to 1v1 combat and defeat them.

templar.name: Templar
templar.description: You are the embodiment of the Emperor's vengeance and Wrath is your currency.

starting_moves.name: Wrath Embodied
starting_moves.description:
You are the Emperor's vengeance made manifest and {{templay.resource}} is your currency. The more pure your soul, the more holy power can pass through you. If your soul is immaculate, then you have 3 {{templar.resource}} (the max).
When you spend time performing your purifcation ritual (an uninterrupted hour or so), set your {{templar.resource}} to the max.

starting_moves.name: Penance
starting_moves.description: When you quickly perform penance, you suffer 1 wound and gain 1 {{templar.resource}}. Penance is self punishment, such as tightening a cilice, using a whip or knout, or other forms of mortification of the ﬂesh. This type of brutal penance might be painful, but it's the only way to purify your soul quickly, such as in the midst of a battle.

starting_moves.name: Smite
starting_moves.description:
When you roll a 10+ on {{move hack_and_slash}} or {{move fire_for_effect}} you may spend 1 {{templar.resource}} to choose one:

  • Your attack burns with the Emperor's fury, inflict +1 wound
  • Your attack creates an opening, you and your allies take +1 forward against your target

starting_moves.name: Divine Will
starting_moves.description: When you use the Emperor's impending vengeance as leverage, you may roll {{move parley}} with +{{templar.resource}} instead of +{{stat 'fel'}}.

advanced_moves.name: Holy Vengeance
advanced_moves.description: When you kill an enemy that has done you harm, you gain 1 {{templar.resource}}.

advanced_moves.name: Know Thy Enemy
advanced_moves.description: Your zeal for exacting the Emperor's wrath has led you to know of some of the Imperium's greatest enemies. You may {{move spout_forbidden_lore}} about known heretics, witches, and traitors.

death_world.name: Death World
death_world.description: Planet where everything wants to kill you.
death_world.move: Death World characters gain +1 on all {{{move last_breath}}} rolls.

feral_world.name: Feral World
feral_world.description: A planet with very little technology.
feral_world.move: Feral World characters +1 piercing when using primitive weapons.

forge_world.name: Forge World
forge_world.move: Forge World characters replace one of their d6s with a d8 when rolling Tech-Use.

highborn.name: Highborn
highborn.description: You are the member of a noble house, or powerful family.
highborn.move: Highborn characters gain +1 to any {{{move defy_danger}}} or Parley rolls that involve talking to members of the Imperium.

hive_world.name: Hive World
hive_world.description: Hab blocks and cityscape cover much of this planet.
hive_world.move: Hive World characters gain +1 to any {{{move last_breath}}} rolls when moving through crowds.
hive_world.bonus: Choose one advanced move from the general Advanced Moves list.

shrine_world.name: Shrine World
shrine_world.description: This world is dedicated to the veneration of the God-Emperor and his saints.
shrine_world.move: Shrine World characters can reroll any double 1s result once per session.

voidborn.name: Voidborn
voidborn.description: You were born in the cold of space aboard a ship.
voidborn.move: Voidborn gain +1 to any rolls to resist warp energy.

specialmoves.name: This I Know
specialmoves.description: Once per session, you may invoke your Background to reroll a move. To invoke your Background you must describe how your character's experience or a specific event related to your Background would have helped you in the current situation. The GM and the players at the table have to agree, so the more details the better.

specialmoves.name: End of Session
specialmoves.description:
When you reach the end of a session, choose one of your bonds that you feel is resolved (completely explored, no longer relevant, or otherwise). Ask the player of the character you have the bond with if they agree. If they do, mark XP and write a new bond with whomever you wish.

If you invoked your background with the {{move 'this_i_know'}} move this session, mark XP.

Once bonds have been updated look at your alignment or drive. If you fulfilled that alignment or drive at least once this session, mark XP. Then answer these three questions as a group:

  • Did we learn something new and important to the Inquisition?
  • Did we overcome a notable enemy?
  • Did we acquire a notable artifact that will be valuable to the Inquisition?

For each "yes" answer everyone marks XP.

specialmoves.name: Recover
specialmoves.description: When you do nothing but rest in comfort and safety after a day of rest you recover half your max wounds.

specialmoves.name: Last Breath
specialmoves.description:
When you're dying you see the darkness cloud your vision as you drift into death. Describe what thoughts or prayers spur you on and roll (don't add any stats).

  • On a 10+ you've defied the odds, and barely cling to life.
  • On a 7-9 you live, but your brush with death takes its toll. Describe the lasting effects your body or mind take and the GM will tell you which of your statistics you must reduce permanently by 1.
  • On a 6-, you join the seemingly endless stream of souls to have been lost under the rule of the Imperium.

specialmoves.name: Encumbrance
specialmoves.description:
When you make a move while carrying weight you may be encumbered. If your weight carried is:

  • Equal to or less than your load, you suffer no penalty
  • Less than or equal to your load+2, you take -1 ongoing until you lighten your burden
  • Greater than your load+2, you have a choice: drop at least 1 weight and roll at -1, or automatically fail

statistics.name: Weapon Skill
statistics.description: How well you can hit things.

statistics.name: Strength
statistics.description: How much you can bench press.

statistics.name: Toughness
statistics.description: How much of a beating you can take.

statistics.name: Intelligence
statistics.description: How much you know, how smart you are.

clumsy.name: Clumsy

hatred.name: Hatred
hatred.description:
Your hatred for a particular enemy of the Imperium runs deep. Each time you take this move, select one of the groups below and describe how your hatred took root. Whenever you deal damage against a hated enemy, roll an extra damage die.

  • Xenos (choose a species)
  • Criminals
  • Daemons
  • Psykers
  • Mutants
  • Cultists

rapid_reload.name: Rapid Reload
rapid_reload.description: When you attempt to reload quickly roll+{{stat 'ag'}}. On a 10+ you reload your weapon instantly - reset its uses and reduce your ammo by one. On a 7-9 the same in addition to what that the GM says. On a 6- you fumble your reload.

Be careful, too much comfort with blasphemous knowledge can draw the eye of loyal servants of the Imperium.

fire_for_effect.description:
When you fire your ranged weapon to deal damage, roll+{{stat 'bs'}} and expend a use of your weapon. On a 10+ deal your damage. At your option you may expend another use of your weapon to add +1d4 damage. On a 7-9 you deal your damage and choose one:

  • You take what you can get, deal -1d6 damage
  • You need to take some more shots, expend another use of your weapon
  • You have to place yourself or a teammate in danger, the GM will tell you how
fire_for_effect.explanation:
{{fire_for_effect.name}} is your go-to move when a character is shooting to kill. It covers drawing, cocking, aiming, and shooting your weapon. Firing your weapon doesn't mean squeezing off a single shot, it means shooting for a few seconds. That can mean a single shot, or a whole flurry of them. Either way, it's a single use of the weapon. Leave the exact number of shots to the fiction and let the uses dictate when they run low.

If you're using a weapon that doesn't have enough uses you can't take the bonus damage on the 10+ or the "expend another use" option on a 7-9.

hack_and_slash.name: Hack and Slash
hack_and_slash.description: When you attack an enemy in melee, roll+{{stat 'ws'}}. On a 10+, you deal your damage to the enemy and avoid their attack. At your option, you may choose to roll an extra damage die but expose yourself to the enemy's attack. On a 7-9, you deal your damage to the enemy and the enemy makes an attack against you.
hack_and_slash.explanation: The extra damage die you roll will be the largest size that you are already rolling. If your attack deals 1d8+1d6 damage, you would roll 2d8+1d6.

parley.name: Parley
parley.description: When you have leverage on a GM Character and manipulate them, roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. Leverage is something they need or want. On a 10+, they do what you ask if you first promise what they ask of you. On a 7–9, they will do what you ask, but need some concrete assurance of your promise, right now.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: When you take a moment to reload your weapon reset your weapon's uses and expend 1 ammo.
reload.explanation: Once a character has expended all the uses of their weapon they need to reload. This isn't assumed, the players have to explicitly say they take a moment to reload. How long it takes is up to the GM, and reloading certainly counts as a prime opportunity for a GM move.

faceless.name: Faceless
faceless.description: When you talk to someone you don't want to remember you, roll+{{stat 'wp'}}. On a 10+ they don't remember you, and barely remember the conversation. On a 7-9 they don't remember specifics about you, but they remember what they talked about.

detective.name: Detective
detective.description: When you get a 7+ using {{move discern_realities}} on a crime scene you also find a clue of value to you. On a 10+ this clue gives you a hunch that the GM will describe.

take_them_alive.name: Take Them Alive
take_them_alive.description:
If you successfully hit a vulnerable opponent and attempt to disable them instead of dealing damage. roll+{{stat 's'}}. On a 7+ they are incapacitated. On a 7-9 choose 1:

  • They get one last attack in
  • They will need some time to recover to be of any use

this_ones_mine.name: This One's Mine
this_ones_mine.description: When you call out a target as your own, you deal +2d4 ongoing to them. This lasts until an ally attacks them, you attack someone else, or the target is defeated. While this is active you deal -4 damage to other targets and your allies deal -2 damage to your named target.

torturer.name: Torturer
torturer.description: When you roll a 7+ with {{move confessor}} you may choose to select zero options from the list. If you do so, roll+Int – on a 6- your captive dies.

baptised_by_bullets.name: Baptised By Bullets
baptised_by_bullets.description: Whenever you run through enemy fire, take +1 forward to {{move defy_danger}}.

lifting_the_fog.name: Lifting the Fog
lifting_the_fog.description:
The fog of war can mask any battle. As you witness it unfold, whenever you or someone you have a bond with takes damage gain 1 {{tactician.resource}} (Max 2). During the battle you may spend 1 {{tactician.resource}} to:

  • Add +1 to one of your rolls before your roll
  • Reroll a damage roll (yours or an ally's)

At the end of the battle your {{tactician.resource}} resets to 0.

sense_weakness.name: Sense Weakness
sense_weakness.description:
When you {{move discern_realities}} about a person or being, you may add the following question to your list of options:

  • What weaknesses do I see?

You may spend 1 {{tactician.resource}} to ask this as an extra question.

tactical_advantage.name: Tactical Advantage
tactical_advantage.description:
Each battle is different and requires a different approach. At the start of each battle, decide which tactic you are actively employing.

  • Defensive: As long as you don't attempt to gain ground, you gain +1 to all {{move defy_danger}} rolls
  • Reactive: Whenever you are attacked, you can immediately respond and take +1 forward
  • Reckless: You deal an extra damage die, but your defense is reduced by 1
  • Precise: While you remain focused on a single target, you inflict +1 wounds when you damage them

If you change tactics you lose the benefit of the one you had chosen.

divine_will.name: Divine Will
divine_will.description: When you use the Emperor's impending vengeance as leverage, you may roll {{move parley}} with +{{templar.resource}} instead of +{{stat 'fel'}}.

holy_vengeance.name: Holy Vengeance
holy_vengeance.description: When you kill an enemy that has done you harm, you gain 1 {{templar.resource}}.

judgement.name: Judgement
judgement.description: When you declare for all to hear someone's crimes deserving of punishment, spend 1 {{templar.resource}}. The next time you attack them, treat their defense as 1 lower.

know_thy_enemy.name: Know Thy Enemy
know_thy_enemy.description: Your zeal for exacting the Emperor's wrath has led you to know of some of the Imperium's greatest enemies. You may {{move spout_forbidden_lore}} about known heretics, witches, and traitors.

penance.name: Penance
penance.description: When you quickly perform penance, you suffer 1 wound and gain 1 {{templar.resource}}. Penance is self punishment, such as tightening a cilice, using a whip or knout, or other forms of mortification of the ﬂesh. This type of brutal penance might be painful, but it's the only way to purify your soul quickly, such as in the midst of a battle.

smite.name: Smite
smite.description:
When you roll a 10+ on {{move hack_and_slash}} or {{move fire_for_effect}} you may spend 1 {{templar.resource}} to choose one:

  • Your attack burns with the Emperor's fury, inflict +1 wound
  • Your attack creates an opening, you and your allies take +1 forward against your target

wrath_embodied.name: Wrath Embodied
wrath_embodied.description:
You are the Emperor's vengeance made manifest and {{templay.resource}} is your currency. The more pure your soul, the more holy power can pass through you. If your soul is immaculate, then you have 3 {{templar.resource}} (the max).
When you spend time performing your purifcation ritual (an uninterrupted hour or so), set your {{templar.resource}} to the max.

armored.name: Armored
armored.description: You ignore the {{tag 'clumsy'}} tag on any armor you wear.

encumbrance.name: Encumbrance
encumbrance.description:
When you make a move while carrying weight you may be encumbered. If your weight carried is:

  • Equal to or less than your load, you suffer no penalty
  • Less than or equal to your load+2, you take -1 ongoing until you lighten your burden
  • Greater than your load+2, you have a choice: drop at least 1 weight and roll at -1, or automatically fail

end_of_session.name: End of Session
end_of_session.description:
When you reach the end of a session, choose one of your bonds that you feel is resolved (completely explored, no longer relevant, or otherwise). Ask the player of the character you have the bond with if they agree. If they do, mark XP and write a new bond with whomever you wish.

If you invoked your background with the {{move 'this_i_know'}} move this session, mark XP.

Once bonds have been updated look at your alignment or drive. If you fulfilled that alignment or drive at least once this session, mark XP. Then answer these three questions as a group:

  • Did we learn something new and important to the Inquisition?
  • Did we overcome a notable enemy?
  • Did we acquire a notable artifact that will be valuable to the Inquisition?

For each "yes" answer everyone marks XP.

last_breath.name: Last Breath
last_breath.description:
When you're dying you see the darkness cloud your vision as you drift into death. Describe what thoughts or prayers spur you on and roll (don't add any stats).

  • On a 10+ you've defied the odds, and barely cling to life.
  • On a 7-9 you live, but your brush with death takes its toll. Describe the lasting effects your body or mind take and the GM will tell you which of your statistics you must reduce permanently by 1.
  • On a 6-, you join the seemingly endless stream of souls to have been lost under the rule of the Imperium.

recover.name: Recover
recover.description: When you do nothing but rest in comfort and safety after a day of rest you recover half your max wounds.

this_i_know.name: This I Know
this_i_know.description: Once per session, you may invoke your Background to reroll a move. To invoke your Background you must describe how your character's experience or a specific event related to your Background would have helped you in the current situation. The GM and the players at the table have to agree, so the more details the better.

assassin.name: Assassin

starting_moves.name: Unsuspecting Strike
starting_moves.description:
When you get close to your target to make a surprise attack, roll+{{stat 'ag'}} if you use stealth or speed, or roll+{{stat 'fel'}} if you use deception or charm. On a 10+ choose two. On a 7-9 choose one.

  • You don't get into melee with them
  • You deal your damage + 1d6
  • You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it
  • Reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it

starting_moves.name: Blend In
starting_moves.description:
When you stay still to remain inconspicuous as someone passes by, roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 10+ choose two, on a 7-9 choose one:

  • They continue moving past
  • They won't remember your face

starting_moves.name: Preferred Kill
starting_moves.description:
You have focused your training on either hand-to-hand or ranged attacks. Choose one:

  • Blademaster: Once per encounter you may reroll a move that uses your {{statistic 'ws'}}.
  • Sharptshooter: Once per encounter you may reroll a move that uses your {{statistic 'bs'}}.

advanced_moves.name: Silencing Strike
advanced_moves.description: When you roll {{move unsuspecting_strike}} you always prevent your target from raising the alarm, describe how.

advanced_moves.name: Cheap Shot
advanced_moves.description: When using a precise or hand weapon, your {{move unsuspecting_strike}} deals an extra +1d6 damage.

advanced_moves.name: Underdog
advanced_moves.description: When you're outnumbered, you have +1 defense against melee attacks.

advanced_moves.name: Blend In
advanced_moves.description:
When you stay still to remain inconspicuous as someone passes by, roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 10+ choose two, on a 7-9 choose one:

  • They continue moving past
  • They won't remember your face

looks: Dead eyes, charming eyes, angry eyes
Black bodysuit, plain clothes, dirty rags
Buzz cut, elaborate hair, tattooed head
Slim body, athletic body, huge body

drives.name: Brutal
drives.description: Make a mess of a kill to intimidate others.

drives.name: Shadow
drives.description: Kill an enemy before they even know they're in danger.

drives.name: Reckless
drives.description: Leap into danger before a plan is formed.

seeker.name: Seeker
looks: Distrusting eyes, kind eyes, tired eyes
Helmeted head, military cut, or bald
Plain clothes, worn outfit, or uniform
Thin body, fit body, flabby body

starting_moves.name: Confessor
starting_moves.description:
When you interrogate someone to extract information from them roll+{{stat 'fel'}}. On a 7-9 they answer your questions and you choose 2. On a 10+ choose 1 instead.

  • They only answer one question
  • Their answers are vague
  • They resist for longer than you'd planned before they begin to cooperate
  • They attract the attention of those nearby

looks: Blank eyes, fiery eyes, kind eyes
Military cut, messy hair, headband, helmet
Worn uniform, utilitarian clothes, rags
Lean body, hulking body, lithe body

destructive.name: Destructive
destructive.description: Blow something up or dismember a foe.

superious_position.name: Superior Position
superious_position.description: Gain an advantage due to better choice of terrain or surroundings.

weapon_master.name: Weapon Master
weapon_master.description: Use a new weapon in combat or begin training with one.

honor_killer.name: Honor Killer
honor_killer.description: Challenge a foe to 1v1 combat and defeat them.
